data.name: label4.Text
data.value: This application is used to send email messages for mail flow testing. I work as a support engineer with Microsoft and support Exchange Online. I often have the need to send email messages to particular endpoints. I got tired to using Telnet for this and developed this application to assist in my work.

data.name: textBox1.Text
data.value:
3.0.0 (May 16, 2019) - lauch on Github! - code cleanup (comments, redundant lines, formatting) - added check box to disable the "is recipient server reachable" test - "sending message timeout" is now configurable - input validation test for timeout text box (ensures value is a number) - with server test not enabled, test app at home - if "recipient server" was checked but nothing was entered in the text box the error would not trigger properly. This is now fixed.
2.8.0 (March 21, 2019) - double clicking on a cell in the log now pops up a new window with a text box which contains the contents of that cell. This allows text that may be cut off in the cell to be easily viewed without needing to copy the cell and then paste it into another program like notepad - build version updated on .exe file. If you right click the EXE and look at properties, the version now properly matches the application version. Previously it was showing version 2.5.1 - Port can now always be changed. Previously, it could only be changed if you checked off "manually specify receiving server." - Text validation is now performed on the Port text box. An error will appear if this text box contains anything other than an integer. - Cleaned up some text boxes that did not have a header on them (added "Input Validation" as the header - Hitting TAB now logically cycles between all controls which can be modified - Due to order processing previously, if the recipient server was not accessible over the specified port, a text box would appear with a nonsensical error. Now, if the recipient server cannot be reached, a clear error will pop up. - the code that detects if an end point is reachable has been optimized and better calls out a connection issue if the end point cannot be reached
2.7.0 (November 30, 2018) - Error messages from remote servers now populate in the log. Previously the error message would only appear in a popup window
2.6.1 (August 24, 2018) - Previous update (2.6.0) introduced an issue that caused adding a P2 from address to not work. This update fixes that issue
2.6.0 (June 27, 2018) - Error messages that are received from the recipient server now appear in a text box which allows the error to be copied - The message that appeared when there was an issue with DNS resolution is now more informative - The "From" tag changed to "MailFrom" which better represents what this text field represents - Typos fixed on some message boxes
2.5.1 (June 30, 2016) - MX lookups for the @microsoft.com domain now complete succesfully if you are on the corporate Microsoft network
2.5.0 (December 3, 2015) - A Reply-To address can now be set under Advanced Options - UI consistency updates
2.4.3 (October 15, 2015) - A new item has been added under Options called "Append date to subject." This will append the current date and time to the subject when a message is sent. The resulting subject will be visible in the log view. - The option "manually specify recipient server" is now unchecked by default.
2.4.1 (September 28, 2015) - Application width can now be changed while the log is visible (there is a minimum width that the application enforces while the log is visible). - DNS resolution errors now appear in the log. - Message send failures no longer add a MessageID to their corresponding log entry. - Instructions to use the application have been added as a link to the About form. - UI updates for consistency across the application.
2.3.5 (July 23, 2015) - Application now gracefully closes the TCP connections that it establishes. You will no longer see RST (resets) in a network trace. You will see the proper [FIN, ACK] TCP teardown sequence after the message is sent.
2.3.4 (June 22, 2015) - TCP connection to see if recipient server is reachable did not close after it was established. This connection now properly closes. - TCP connection to see if recipient server is reachable always used port 25. This test now properly uses the port entered into the application. - Start menu folder name changed from "Andrew Stobart" to "Mail Flow Tester" - Button style on About form changed to be white and flat to match the UI in the main form - Change log textbox background changed to be white to match the UI in the main form
2.3.2 (March 17, 2015) - Minor bug fixes
2.3.1 (February 23, 2015) - Message-ID for outbound messages is now added to the log - Cell contents in the log can be copied by right clicking on them and selecting "copy cell" - Window width reduced when the log is visible - Can export the log to a CSV file - Clear Log button will now prompt for confirmation
2.2.3 (January 16, 2015) - More than one custom header can now be added - MX lookup code is now more robust. If the first query fails, a second will be performed - Individual rows can now be deleted from the log
2.1.2 (January 8, 2015) - Logging of sent messages (check box "View log") - App now checks connectivity to reciving server before attempting to send the message (timeout is 3 seconds)
2.0.2 (October 31, 2014) - Added checkbox to show and hide advanced options - Program now has ability to do an MX lookup - Tabbing through text boxes now moves in order from top to bottom
1.8.2 (October 23, 2014) - Added a change log to the about box - Added a ToolTip to the TO textbox
1.8.1 (October 7, 2014) - Initial release on CodeBox - Added the ability to set both a P1 and P2 from address - Added ability to add a custom x-header - Added ability to attach multiple attachments. Previously you could only attach one. - Added an about box
1.5 (April 8, 2014) - Added the ability to set a custom port
1.4 (April 1, 2014) - Added ability to toggle TLS on or off - Disable "send" button to prevent clicking while app is sending a message
1.1 (March 31, 2014) - Ability to remove an added attachment
1.0 (March 2014) - Andrew's initial release of the program
